FuncDef:
The nat log radius enable command enables a NAT device to send a real-time accounting packet to a RADIUS server to inform the server of a port range change.
The undo nat log radius enable command disables a NAT device from sending a real-time accounting packet to a RADIUS server to inform the server of a port range change.
By default, a NAT device sends a real-time accounting packet to a RADIUS server to inform the server of a port range change.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the semi-dynamic port pre-allocation mode is configured, the available port range is automatically extended after the initial port range is exhausted. If the nat log radius enable command is run, the system will send a real-time accounting packet to a RADIUS server to inform the server of the port range change.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E.
